greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: T(n,k) = binomial(n, k) - 1 + q^floor(n/2)*binomial(n-2, k-1) for 0 < k < n with T(n,0) = T(n,n) = 1 and q = 3. Triangle read by rows.
formula: T(n, k) = binomial(n, k) - 1 + 3^floor(n/2)*binomial(n-2, k-1) for 0 < k < n.
mathematica: T[n_, m_] := If[m == 0 || m == n, 1, Binomial[n, m] - 1 + 3^Floor[n/2] Binomial[n - 2, m - 1]]; Table[T[n, m], {n, 0, 10}, {m, 0, n}] // Flatten
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Feb 09 2010
